Package audio

Class AudioPlayer

java.lang.Object
audio.AudioPlayer
public class AudioPlayer extends Object
A simple player that plays audio files

  • Constructor Details

    • AudioPlayer

      public AudioPlayer(String filePath)
      Initialises the player with a path to an audio-file.

      The audio may sometimes not be played when repeatedly playing the clip (this is caused by the buffer-size being too large for the interval in which the audio is to be played).

      Use AudioPlayer(String, int) if the audio should be cut off instead.

      Parameters:
      filePath - Path to the audio file which is to be played (as String).

    • AudioPlayer

      public AudioPlayer(String filePath, int timeWindow)
      Initialises the player with a path to an audio-file and the timeWindow in which the sound is to be played. The timeWindow is used to calculate the buffer-size, which is needed to play the clip.

      The audio file is cut of, if it is too long to play in the given time-window.

      According to ...:

      • buffer size too large -> sometimes sounds are not played when repeatedly playing the clip.
      • buffer size too small -> artifacts like clicking or tearing.
      Parameters:
      filePath - Path to the audio file which is to be played (as String).
      timeWindow - time in which the sound is to be played [in ms] ( for example: time between 2 frames in the game).

  • Method Details

    • play

      public void play()
      plays the audio file from the start.

      if this method is called while the clip is already playing, the old playback is stopped and the new playback starts.

    • playAndClose

      public void playAndClose()
      plays the audio file from the start and then frees the resources.

    • setVolume

      public void setVolume(float volume)
      sets the volume of the audio.
      Parameters:
      volume - value from 0 to 1, where 1 is full volume and 0 is no sound.

    • close

      public void close()
      frees the resources used.
